quiz.title: Economics: Supply, Equilibrium, and Demand Shifts

questions.question: An increase in the supply of a commodity is caused by:
options: A rise in the commodity's own price
An increase in the cost of raw materials
questions.explanation: Technology improvements lower production costs, shifting the supply curve rightward (increase in supply).

questions.question: When price is below equilibrium level, there will be:
options: Shortage of commodity in the market
questions.explanation: At a price below equilibrium, quantity demanded exceeds quantity supplied, causing a shortage.

questions.question: The following are causes of shift in demand EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: A change in the good’s own price causes movement along the demand curve, not a shift of the demand curve.

questions.question: When demand is perfectly inelastic, an increase in price will result in:
questions.explanation: Perfectly inelastic demand means quantity demanded does not change when price changes, so total revenue (= price × quantity) rises when price rises.
